item.title: Overview
item.description: What is Firebase? Firebase is a mobile and web application platform for developers Acquired by Google in 2014 Offers many other services but we’ll be covering the basics of Firebase’s real-time backend database and seeing how we can use this in our applications

item.title: Benefits
item.description: Firebase Benefits Firebase provides a seamless way for front-end developers to add data persistence to their front-end applications Relieves developers from having to build out backend to support their apps Firebase platform offers a variety of products such as realtime database, authentication, file storage, analytics, hosting, etc Generous free tier Advanced features that developers can grow their applications into as their applications grow

item.title: NoSQL Databases
item.description: What is a NoSQL Database Firebase uses a NoSQL for it’s cloud-based databases Like many NoSQL databases, Firebase’s Real-time database stores data as JSON objects NoSQL databases don’t enforce strict data structure which results in much more flexibility than traditional SQL databases Downsides: when dealing with “loosely structured” data, common use cases such as building out relationships (for example: a student has many courses, and courses contain many students) in your data can be non-intuitive and complex
